questions.neutral: Feel like a slow night to you?

hobby.message: Urban exploration or just drinking underground?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Slow enough, I guess. Not many calls for late shifts tonight.
Been keeping myself busy with… urban exploration, that’s my thing these days.
Strange week for it. Places I used to reach now just won’t open.
Found more doors locked than usual since the BCI reset.
Yeah, running slower lately. Not much demand for system work after hours.
I pass time poking around old utility tunnels. Keeps me occupied.
If you call that a hobby—I guess I do.
The amnesty on scores locked down nearly half my usual routes.
Suppose everyone’s gotten a bit cautious now.
Feels slow, but I don’t mind. Gives me a chance to sneak out.
Urban exploring—the old infrastructure, utility tunnels, sometimes data centers.
Been doing it since before I left state work.
Used to navigate with a trace file or two, badge would handle the rest.
Lately, with this BCI amnesty, most of my regular places are just sealed off.
Makes the hobby more interesting. Or more annoying, depending how you look at it.
Definitely slow. Suits me, gives more time for my little adventures underground.
I’m into urban exploration—collecting old system maps, slipping through half-abandoned service shafts.
Some nights, I check ventilation ducts no one’s bothered to log since Halden was alive.
Usually the BCI opened doors for me, even if my score was low.
Now, after the reset, I can’t even get into half the good spots.
Ran into some of the ‘ghosts’ last time. Turns out, nobody’s got access now.
Funny how score amnesty evens the playing field. Everyone’s locked out.
It’s a slow night, and that’s just fine by me lately.
Most folks wind down with a show or some cards—I break into forgotten city corners.
Urban exploration’s the hobby, ever since state work lost its charm. Utility tunnels, ghosted data rooms.
You’d be surprised how much history’s hidden under our boots.
Used to wander anywhere my badge let me in, even when I skated close to compliance warnings.
Since the BCI amnesty, every access route’s a mess. My old workarounds? Gone.
Last week, shared a bottle in a sealed pump room with two ghosts—nobody’s got clearance now.
Strange how the system’s chaos brings people together in lost places. Not always a bad thing.
hobby_answer: Yeah, was out.
Not like you need a score to walk the drainage line.
Lots more quiet since the reset started.
Don’t see many faces these days.
Harder to get in anywhere, but you make do.
Urban tunnels again, sure.
Getting trickier. With the BCI amnesty, no access, old codes useless.
Had to find other ways in.
Fewer patrols lately, but also more ghosts roaming.
Does mean I spend more time in the dark than usual.
Can’t count on the system to open doors now.
Yeah, urban exploring—habit’s hard to drop.
Was down by the old substation last night.
With the city’s score reset, all the usual locks are unpredictable.
Met a few ghosts hiding out, swapping stories.
Funny how when everyone’s neutral, no one can block you—but no one gets in easy, either.
Whole place feels off-balance. Less patrols, more shadows.
Hobby’s changed since the chaos. Makes you notice who’s still moving.
You guessed it. Tunnels and relay rooms are quieter now.
Last night, had to crawl in instead of badge-swipe—no BCI clearance.
Ran into a couple ghosts camped out by an old drain hatch.
We shared a drink, talked about all the doors stuck shut these days.
Funny, the system keeps us out and locks us in at the same time.
Used to love mapping out new paths—now, every route is a gamble.
Amnesty evened things up, but feels like no one’s sure what’s next.
Makes me wonder how many old maps Halden kept to himself.
Right as always, Alex. Spent half the night in the undercity again.
Tried the old badge, nothing—zero score since I helped wipe the logs.
Had to shimmy through a skip tunnel, scraped the hell out of my boots.
Ran into ghosts—real ones, the data-erased, hiding out since the reset.
We swapped BCI horror stories, passed my flask around, even started mapping new routes.
Whole city’s limping—doors jammed, alarms off, some sectors run on rumor only now.
Feels like the tunnels have more life than the streets lately. Safer, too.
Admit it, half of what I know I learned down there—wires, faults, people’s secrets.
Doubt they’ll ever patch all the holes. Good for explorers, bad for the Council.
